author: Ryan Mancini
description: Columnist and author Michael Wolff on Wednesday said he communicated with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein to talk about his relationship President Trump, prior to his first White House run in 2016. House Oversight and Government Reform Committee Democrats released three email exchanges from Epstein with Wolff. Some emails showed Epstein saying that Trump “knew about the girls.” “I…
title: Wolff: Emails meant to get Epstein to talk about Trump relationship

author: Caroline Vakil
description: President Trump has hit his lowest approval rating since taking office for his second term in the White House, according to a Decision Desk HQ (DDHQ) polling average.  Trump’s approval rating stands at an average of nearly 42 percent, with an average disapproval rating of close to 55 percent, according to DDHQ. “If you have a…
title: Trump hits lowest approval rating of second term in DDHQ polling average

author: Iman Palm
description: Dana Williamson, former chief of staff to Gov. Gavin Newsom, has been indicted on multiple corruption charges, including conspiracy to commit bank and wire fraud, bank fraud, wire fraud, conspiracy to defraud the United States, and obstruct justice, as well as subscribing to false tax returns and making false statements.
title: California Gov. Gavin Newsom’s former chief of staff indicted on public corruption charges

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Democrats have been pushing back on Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) after eight party members voted in favor of a stopgap measure to reopen the government.  The 60-40 vote approving a continuing resolution to fund much of the government until Jan. 30 leaves health care subsidies in limbo, cementing disdain for Schumer, who previously…
title: Here are the Democrats calling for Schumer to be replaced as leader

author: The Hill Staff
description: After nearly two months away, the House is returning to Washington to vote Wednesday on a funding measure to reopen the government after a record-long shutdown. Senators — following weeks of tension and 14 failed votes — advanced a measure earlier this week that will provide funding until Jan. 30 for most departments and fund…
title: Watch live: House poised to vote on ending historic government shutdown

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: More than 3,500 cases of pertussis, or whooping cough, have been reported in Texas so far this year, according to state figures, roughly four times the number as last year and the highest since 2013.  This is the second consecutive year that Texas is experiencing high year-over-year increases in reported pertussis cases. With about seven…
title: Whooping cough cases skyrocket to record high in Texas

author: Max Rego
description: Republicans on the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee released 20,000 pages of documents from the estate of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein on Wednesday, hours after Democrats on the committee released emails in which the disgraced financier alleged that President Trump “knew about the girls.” Earlier Wednesday, Democrats on the committee released three emails…
title: GOP lawmakers release thousands of files related to Jeffrey Epstein

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. John Fetterman (Pa.), a rare Democrat who has defended President Trump at times, on Wednesday said new reports that the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein mentioned Trump in detail in his emails is “absolutely troubling.” “I have followed it, of course,” Fetterman told CNN’s Dana Bash when asked about Epstein’s emails mentioning Trump. “Yeah,…
title: Fetterman on new Epstein emails mentioning Trump: ‘Absolutely troubling’

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Affordability, affordability, affordability — that is the word on everyone’s minds.   Democrats performed well in last week’s elections by focusing on this very theme, which encompasses housing availability and inflation and education costs and child care and health care and so many other things. When they discuss “affordability” in vague terms, Democrats are even…
title: Ben Shapiro warns young people to flee New York City, socialism

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Disney is losing out on millions of dollars per day as its carrier dispute with YouTubeTV stretches into another week. New estimates from Morgan Stanley analyst Benjamin Swinburne finds Disney could lose out on $60 million in lost revenue if the stalemate reaches 14 days, The Wrap reported. Disney-owned channels like ABC, ESPN and others…
title: Disney losing $4 million per day on YouTubeTV dispute

author: The Hill Staff
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) and Democratic leaders will speak with reporters Wednesday afternoon as the House prepares to vote on the Senate-backed funding measure that could reopen the government after a record-long shutdown. The Democrats have been whipping votes against the continuing resolution, which includes funding for some departments through the next fiscal…
title: Watch live: Jeffries, Dems speak ahead of House vote on bill to reopen government

author: Laura Kelly
description: The office of Israeli President Isaac Herzog announced Wednesday it had received a letter from President Trump requesting a pardon for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is currently standing trial for bribery, fraud and breach of trust.  Trump, who was convicted in a criminal case of 34 felony counts in 2024, has called several…
title: Trump pens letter to Israeli president requesting pardon for Netanyahu

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The U.S. Mint in Philadelphia is set to press its final penny on Wednesday in accordance with the Trump administration’s February directive ending production for the 1-cent coin.  As the penny slowly runs out of circulation, businesses will have to round up or down prices to the nearest five cents to provide customers change.  However,…
title: US Mint in Philadelphia set to press final penny

author: Imran Khalid, opinion contributor
description: President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping have struck a deal in Busan to prioritize a frozen conflict in Ukraine, with the U.S. reducing military pressure in the Pacific and China leaning on Russia to accept a ceasefire, in exchange for a durable ceasefire along the current front line.
title: The Busan Bargain: Trump and Xi are quietly redrawing the Ukraine endgame

author: The Hill Staff
description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt will brief reporters Wednesday afternoon as an end to the government shutdown is finally in sight. President Trump signaled his support for the Senate-passed version of the continuing resolution earlier this week as lawmakers have fought for weeks over how to end the 43-day lapse in funding. The House…
title: Watch live: White House briefs press ahead of House vote to end shutdown

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: House Republicans and Democrats alike slammed a provision in the shutdown-ending funding measure that would give senators the opportunity to earn significant amounts of money from litigation challenging the seizure of their phone records as part of former special counsel Jack Smith’s Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack probe. The provision, which is retroactive to 2022, allows…
title: House Republicans slam Senate litigation provision in funding bill: ‘Self-serving’

author: Tara Suter
description: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani (D) said he will call President Trump, who has gone after him intensely as his political star has risen, in the coming weeks. “Do you plan to call President Trump?” WNBC’s Melissa Russo asked Mamdani in an interview that aired Tuesday. “I will be reaching out to the White…
title: Mamdani says he will call Trump in coming weeks: ‘This is a relationship that will be critical to the success of the city’

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The White House defended President Trump’s handling of Jeffrey Epstein, accusing Democrats of “selectively” releasing emails from the deceased sex offender that reference the president. The comment comes after House Oversight Democrats released three email exchanges from Epstein as he corresponded with his associate Ghislaine Maxwell as well as columnist and author Michael Wolff. In the emails…
title: White House responds to Epstein emails invoking Trump

author: Julia Manchester
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) dug in on her criticism of President Trump in a social media post Wednesday, appearing to take aim at the president’s recent comments on H-1B visas and foreign policy. “I believe you are good, talented, creative, intelligent, hard working, and want to achieve,” Greene said in a post on social…
title: Greene criticizes Trump on H-1B visas, Chinese students in US

author: Noa Greene-Houvras, opinion contributor
description: By treating the climate as a solely technological challenge, Gates draws incorrect conclusions.
title: How Bill Gates’s ‘tough talk’ on climate change gets it wrong

author: Brad Bannon, opinion contributor
description: Eight Democratic senators joined the Republican majority to end the federal government shutdown, resulting in increased health insurance premiums for millions of Americans, despite the Democratic Party's recent success in the elections.
title: Democratic Senate defections will allow Trump’s huge insurance premium hikes

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Almost 900 flights were canceled nationwide Wednesday morning, hours ahead of a vote in the House that could end the more than 40-day government shutdown.  A total of 888 flights within, into or out of the U.S. were canceled Wednesday, according to data from FlightAware’s tracking system. Another 720 trips were delayed, according to the website.…
title: Almost 900 flights canceled early Wednesday ahead of House shutdown vote

author: Teddy Grant
description: The Vatican will host an event with Hollywood stars such as Cate Blanchett, Chris Pine and Viggo Mortensen.
title: Pope Leo shares his favorite movies before Vatican event

author: Nick Jachim
description: (NEXSTAR) – The English language can certainly be a bit confusing at times. Some words have multiple meanings, like “clear,” “light” and “mine.” Other words sound exactly the same but have different meanings and spellings, like “their,” “there” and “they’re.” And some words just don’t sound anything like they’re spelled, giving trouble to Americans every…
title: People in your state just can’t pronounce this word correctly, report suggests

author: Tara Suter
description: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro told Americans concerned about rising food costs that he felt “their pain” as the issue of affordability came to the forefront after last week’s Democratic election victories. In an interview that aired Tuesday on NewsNation’s “On Balance with Leland Vittert,” the anchor pressed Navarro on the concerns of a…
title: Navarro to Americans concerned about rising food costs: ‘We feel your pain’

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Tommy Tuberville (R-Ala.), a close ally of President Trump, is predicting that Senate Democrats could shut down the government four or five more times if Republicans don’t change the Senate’s rules to eliminate the filibuster. “Here’s what I’m worried about. Government shutdown, if we do happen to open it up, they’re gonna shut it…
title: GOP senator Tuberville predicts Democrats will do ‘four or five more shutdowns’ if filibuster stays

author: Addy Bink
description: The northern lights reached as far south as Florida overnight, thanks to some strong geomagnetic storming. If we're lucky, we may get another glimpse again Wednesday night.
title: Will US see the northern lights again Wednesday? Here’s the forecast

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: College enrollment is up for the third year in a row, including increases in both undergraduate and community college attendance after a dip during the pandemic, according to newly released numbers. In a preliminary report, the National Student Clearinghouse Research Center found undergraduate enrollment up 2.4 percent, with increases across all sectors.  Community colleges saw…
title: Enrollment up among undergraduates, community colleges ticks up: Report

author: Diana Falzone
description: A CEO of a paid protest group is pushing for a law requiring more transparency around who pays demonstrators.
title: Paid protest CEO urges Congress to pass law exposing who funds demonstrations

author: Tanner Willis, opinion contributor
description: The path forward is simple: Pass the laws, invite the challenge and let the court decide.
title: How states can pave a path toward congressional term limits

author: Richard Lorenc, opinion contributor
description: Overton’s window seems broken, or closed, largely because few of us seem willing to listen to those who may hold opinions different from our own.
title: Instead of guiding us, the Overton window now mirrors our divisions

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Emails released by Democrats show convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein telling associates in the 2010s that “of course” President Trump knew about his relationships with underage girls. The three emails, released Wednesday by Democrats on the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee, show Epstein’s correspondence with his associate Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as columnist and…
title: Epstein alleges Trump ‘knew about the girls’ in emails released by House Democrats

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is expected to host a group of Wall Street executives at the White House on Wednesday, including leaders from JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs. A White House official confirmed Trump was set to dine with business leaders including JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon and Nasdaq CEO Adena Friedman. Other guests include Goldman Sachs…
title: Trump expected to host Wall Street CEOs at White House dinner

author: Vinay Simlot
description: Two men were among the thousands of U.S. soldiers killed during the Korean War, yet their names were left off the war memorial. Their families are fighting to change that.
title: ‘Sign of disrespect’: Families fighting to get names of soldiers killed in Korean War on memorial

author: Arturo McFields, opinion contributor
description: The hope of Venezuelans has grown greatly since Sept. 2.
title: Venezuela is ready for its own liberation day

author: Raymond March and Elisha Denkyirah, opinion contributors
description: We also found that states that legalized recreational marijuana earliest (for example, in the early 2000s) experience larger decreases in opioid deaths.
title: Legalize marijuana to ease the opioid crisis

author: Sudiksha Kochi
description: The House Rules Committee early Wednesday morning advanced a funding measure that would end the longest shutdown in U.S. history, clearing a key procedural hurdle and sending the bill to the floor for consideration. The panel voted 8-4 to advance the measure, which passed the Senate on Monday. It’s the first step taken by the House to…
title: House panel advances funding measure to end record-breaking government shutdown

author: Tara Suter
description: Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) said Tuesday that “no one really knows” who’s heading up his party in both chambers of Congress as tensions flare among Democrats over the ongoing government shutdown. “Who is running the show now in the Democratic Party, in the Senate, in the House?” Fox News’s Lawrence Jones asked Fetterman on “Fox…
title: Fetterman: ‘No one really knows’ who’s running the Democratic Party in Senate, House

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The top Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee slammed a Senate-approved plan to reopen the government that would also pave the way for eight GOP senators to earn significant sums from litigation challenging the search of their phone records related to Jan. 6. Tucked into the GOP proposal, which eight Democratic senators also approved, the…
title: Raskin blasts ‘blatantly corrupt’ Senate deal allowing suits over secret phone record subpoenas

author: Adam Schwager
description: A proposal to reopen the U.S. government that passed the Senate on Monday contains language that would outlaw the sale of intoxicating hemp products across the nation.
title: Federal action may end fight over intoxicating hemp products in Texas

author: Tara Suter
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy on Tuesday warned of “massively more disruption” in air travel if the ongoing government shutdown, which has lasted for more than a month, continues into the weekend. “You’re going to see this Friday, Saturday and Sunday — big disruption thus far — massively more disruption as we come into the weekend,…
title: Duffy warns of ‘massively more disruption’ in air travel if shutdown extends to weekend

author: Mike Lillis
description: House Democratic leaders on Tuesday will propose a three-year extension of the soon-to-expire ObamaCare subsidies at the center of the shutdown fight. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) and Rep. Katherine Clark (Mass.), the Democratic whip, will offer the legislation as an amendment to the Senate-passed spending agreement during a meeting of the Rules Committee…
title: Jeffries, Democrats will offer 3-year extension of ObamaCare subsidies
